Beast Within (PvP Talent) no longer grants attack speed to the Hunter, only pets are affected.
Dire Basilisk (PvP Talent) damage increased by 100%.

Ranger's Finesse (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Casting Aimed Shot provides you with Ranger's Finesse. After gaining 3 stacks of Ranger's Finesse, increase your next Volley's radius and duration by 50% or your next Bursting Shot's slow by 50% and its knockback distance. Consuming Ranger's Finesse reduces the remaining cooldown of Aspect of the Turtle by 20 seconds.

New PvP Talent: Sticky Tar Bomb – Throw a Sticky Tar Bomb that coats your target’s weapons with tar, disarming them for 4 seconds. After 4 seconds, Sticky Tar Bomb explodes onto nearby enemies. Other enemies that are hit by the explosion are affected by Sticky Tar Bomb but this effect cannot spread further.
Sticky Tar (PvP Talent) has been removed.

New PvP Talent: Master Shepherd – While an enemy player is affected by your Polymorph or Mass Polymorph, your movement speed is increased by 25% and your Versatility is increased by 6%. Additionally, Polymorph and Mass Polymorph no longer heal enemies.

New PvP Talent: Ethereal Blink – Blink and Shimmer apply Slow at 100% effectiveness to all enemies you Blink through. For each enemy you Blink through, the cooldown of Blink or Shimmer are reduced by 1 second, up to 5 seconds.
Frostbolt damage increased by 116% in PvP combat (was 100%).
Ice Nova damage increased by 8% in PvP combat.
Dragon’s Breath damage increased by 16% in PvP combat.
Polymorph duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Mass Polymorph duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Ring of Frost duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Netherwind Armor and Prismatic Cloak (PvP Talents) have been removed.

Kleptomania (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Unleash a flurry of disruptive magic onto your target, stealing a beneficial magic effect every .5 seconds for 4 seconds. Castable while moving, but movement speed is reduced by 40% while channeling.
Arcane Missiles damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Mass Invisibility (PvP Talent) now has a 10 second duration, breaks if any actions are taken, and replaces Invisibility when learned.
Arcane Empowerment (PvP Talent) has been removed.
World of Flames (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Empower Flamestrike, dealing up to 200% more damage based on enemies' distance to the center of Flamestrike.

Flamecannon (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Every 2 seconds in combat with no enemies within 20 yards, you gain 3% maximum health, 3% increased damage, and a 3 yard range increase to Fire spells. This effect stacks up to 5 times and lasts for 3 seconds.
Glass Cannon (PvP Talent) now increases damage of Fireball and Scorch by 100% (was 40%) and now also increases the damage of Mastery: Ignite.
Fireball damage increased by 12% in PvP combat.
Flamestrike damage increased by 12% in PvP combat.
Pyroblast damage increased by 12% in PvP combat.
Fire Blast now deals 8% reduced damage in PvP combat (was 21%).
Phoenix Flames damage increased by 16% in PvP combat.
Scorch damage increased by 45% in PvP combat (was 25%).
New PvP Talent: Icy Feet – When your Frost Nova or Water Elemental's Freeze is dispelled or removed, become immune to snares for 3 seconds. This effect can only occur once every 10 seconds.
Frost Bomb (PvP Talent) explosion damage increased by 68%. Dispelling Frost Bomb before its explosion now grants a charge of Brain Freeze.
Comet Storm damage increased by 8% in PvP combat.
Flurry damage increased by 8% in PvP combat.
Ebonbolt damage increased by 12% in PvP combat.
Ice Lance damage increased by 34% in PvP combat (was 20%).
Glacial Spike damage reduced by 5% in PvP combat (was 15%).
Chilled to the Bone (PvP Talent) has been removed.
Leg Sweep duration decreased to 4 seconds in PvP combat (was 5 seconds).
Grapple Weapon (PvP Talent) duration decreased to 5 seconds (was 6 seconds).
Perpetual Paralysis (PvP Talent) now reduces range of Paralysis by 5 yards (was 10 yards) and now selects targets within 10 yards (was 6 yards).
Hot Trub (PvP Talent) now has an additional effect – Also makes your next Breath of Fire incapacitate targets after purifying 100% of your max health.
Guided Meditation (PvP Talent) reduces the cooldown of Zen Meditation by 50% (was 75%).
Rodeo (PvP Talent) now gains a stack every 3 seconds (was 7 seconds). Rodeo now has a maximum stack count of 4 (was 3).
Wind Waker and Incendiary Breath (PvP Talents) have been removed.
Chrysalis (PvP Talent) has been removed from PvP talents. It is now located on a choice node with Burst of Life on the Mistweaver specialization tree.

Thunderous Focus Tea (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Thunder Focus Tea can now additionally cause Crackling Jade Lightning's knockback immediately or cause Roll and Chi Torpedo to refund a charge on use and heal you.
New PvP Talent: Fae Accord – Faeline Stomp's cooldown is reduced by 10 seconds. Enemies struck by Faeline Stomp are snared by 60% for 8 seconds.
New PvP Talent: Zen Spheres – Place a sphere of Hope or Despair on a friendly or enemy target. Only one sphere of each type can be active at a time:
Sphere of Hope – Friendly target receives 15% additional healing from the Monk.
Sphere of Despair – Enemy target deals 10% less damage to the Monk, and suffers 10% additional damage from all sources.
Dome of Mist (PvP Talent) now creates a shield based on 120% of the remaining periodic healing from Enveloping Mist.

New PvP Talent: Stormspirit Strikes – Damaging more than one target with Fists of Fury summons a Storm Spirit to focus your secondary target for 30 seconds, which will mimic any of your attacks that do not also strike the target for 30% of normal damage.
Turbo Fists (PvP Talent) no longer causes Fists of Fury to deal its full damage to all targets hit.
Fists of Fury now deals 90% of its damage to secondary target players.
Rising Sun Kick damage increased by 8% in PvP combat.
Tigereye Brew (PvP Talent) has been removed.
Hammer of Justice duration decreased to 5 seconds in PvP combat (was 6 seconds).
Blinding Light duration decreased to 4 seconds in PvP combat (was 5 seconds).
Repentance duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Turn Evil duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
New PvP Talent: Searing Glare – Call upon the light to blind your enemies in a 20 yard cone, causing enemies to miss their spells and attacks for 4 seconds. 1.25 second cast time, 60 second cooldown.
Flash of Light healing increased by 50% for Holy Paladins in PvP combat (was 25%).
Holy Light healing increased by 100% in PvP combat (was 75%).
Aura Mastery now reduces the damage allies in your aura take by 30% in PvP combat (was 15%).
Vengeance Aura and Light's Grace (PvP Talents) have been removed.
Ultimate Retribution now marks the enemy target for 12 seconds (was 8 seconds).
Hammer of Wrath damage increased by 16% in PvP combat.
Word of Glory healing is now reduced by 45% in PvP combat (was 30%).
Flash of Light healing is now reduced by 30% in PvP combat.
Light’s Celerity increases Flash of Light healing by 10% in PvP combat (was 20%).
New PvP Talent: Phase Shift – Step into the shadows when you cast Fade, avoiding all attacks and spells for 1 second. Interrupt effects are not affected by Phase Shift.
New PvP Talent: Absolute Faith – Leap of Faith also pulls the spirit of the 3 furthest allies within 40 yards and shields all allies affected.
Mind Control duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Shackle Undead duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Psychic Horror duration decreased to 3 seconds in PvP combat (was 4 seconds).
Silence duration decreased to 3 seconds in PvP combat (was 4 seconds).
Eternal Rest and Delivered from Evil (PvP Talents) have been removed.
Power Word: Barrier effectiveness increased by 100% in PvP combat.
Dome of Light has been removed.
The bounce radius of Prayer of Mending has been increased by 10 yards.
Prayer of Mending healing increased by 50% in PvP combat.
Cardinal Mending (PvP Talent) has been removed.
Vampiric Touch damage is no longer reduced in PvP combat (was reduced by 5%).
Mind Spike and Mind Spike: Insanity damage is now increased by 30% in PvP combat (was 25%).
Mind Flay and Surge of Insanity damage is now increased by 30% in PvP combat.
Deathspeaker increases the damage of Shadow Word: Death by 10% in PvP combat (was 25%).
Void Origins (PvP Talent) has been removed.
Dagger in the Dark (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Each second while Stealth is active, nearby enemies within 12 yards take an additional 2% damage from you for 10 seconds. Stacks up to 6 times.
Veil of Midnight (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Now causes Cloak of Shadows to remove harmful physical effects and increases dodge chance by 100%.
Maneuverability (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Sprint has a 50% reduced cooldown and 50% reduced duration.
Blind duration decreased to 5 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Sap duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Kidney Shot duration decreased by 1 second per combo point in PvP combat:
Dismantle (PvP Talent) duration decreased to 5 seconds (was 6 seconds) and energy cost reduced to 15 (was 25).
Distracting Mirage (PvP Talent) now slows affected enemies by 60% (was 30%)
Death from Above (PvP Talent) energy cost reduced to 15 (was 25). Damage bonus increased to 15% (was 10%).
Ambush damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Sinister Strike damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Killing Spree damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Blade Rush damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Ghostly Strike damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Dreadblades damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Mastery: Main Gauche damage increased by 5% in PvP combat.
Dispatch damage increased by 20% in PvP combat (was 15%).
Combat Stamina now increases Stamina by 15% (was 5%) in PvP combat only.
Take Your Cut (PvP Talent) duration increased to 12 seconds (was 8 seconds).
Turn the Tables (PvP Talent) duration increased to 12 seconds (was 6 seconds).
Distracting Mirage (PvP Talent) slow value has been increased to 60% (was 30%).
Backstab damage increased by 30% in PvP combat (was 20%).
Gloomblade damage increased by 30% in PvP combat (was 20%).
Shadowstrike damage increased by 8% in PvP combat.
Eviscerate damage increased by 8% in PvP combat.
Secret Technique damage reduced by 25% in PvP combat (was reduced by 30%).
Thief's Bargain (PvP Talent) damage penalty reduced to 6% (was 10%).
Seasoned Winds and Static Field Totem (PvP Talents) are now available to all specializations (was Elemental and Enhancement only).
Seasoned Winds now lasts 18 seconds and can stack up to 3 times.

New PvP Talent: Burrow – Burrow beneath the ground, becoming unattackable, removing movement impairing effects, and increasing your movement speed by 50% for 5 seconds. When the effect ends, enemies within 6 yards are knocked in the air and take Physical damage.
Lava Burst damage increased by 20% in PvP combat.
Earthgrab Totem duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Hex duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Swelling Waves and Spectral Recovery (PvP Talents) have been removed.

New PvP Talent: Volcanic Surge – Increases the damage of Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning by 25% and the damage of Lava Burst by 45%. Lava Surge has an additional 100% chance to trigger and instead reduces the cast time of your next Lightning Bolt or Chain Lightning by 25%, stacking up to 2 times.
Stormkeeper increases Lightning Bolt damage by 30% in PvP combat (was 115%).
Casting Lightning Bolt with Surge of Power causes 1 additional Elemental Overload in PvP combat (was 2).
Lightning Bolt damage increased by 53% in PvP combat.
Primordial Surge's damage bonus is no longer reduced in PvP combat.
Control of Lava (PvP Talent) has been removed.
New PvP Talent: Stormweaver – Consuming Maelstrom Weapon on a damage spell causes your next Healing Surge or Chain Heal to gain the full benefits of Maelstrom Weapon based on the stacks consumed.
The healing bonus from Improved Maelstrom Weapon is reduced by 75% in PvP combat (was 25%).
The healing bonus from Raging Maelstrom is now reduced by 60% in PvP combat (was 40%).
Bloodlust and Heroism are no longer on the global cooldown when affected by Shamanism.
Ethereal Form and Thundercharge (PvP Talents) have been removed.
New PvP Talent: Rain Dance – Healing Rain is now instant, 20% more effective, and costs 30% less mana.
Healing Surge healing increased by 6% in PvP combat.
Cleansing Waters (PvP Talent) has been removed.
New PvP Talent: Impish Instincts – Taking direct Physical damage reduces the cooldown of Demonic Circle by 2 seconds. Cannot occur more than once every 5 seconds.

New PvP Talent: Soul Rip – Fracture the soul of up to 3 target players within 20 yards into the shadows, reducing their damage done by 25% and healing received by 25% for 8 seconds. Souls are fractured up to 20 yards from the player’s location. Players can retrieve their souls to remove this effect. 1 minute cooldown, costs 1 Soul Shard.
Bonds of Fel (PvP Talent) explosion damage increased by 33%.
Seduction duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Banish duration decreased to 6 seconds in PvP combat (was 8 seconds).
Axe Toss (Stun and Interrupt) duration decreased to 3 seconds in PvP combat (was 4 seconds).
Grimoire: Felguard (Stun and Interrupt) duration decreased to 3 seconds in PvP combat (was 4 seconds).
Spell Lock (Grimoire of Sacrifice version) interrupt duration decreased to 5 seconds in PvP combat (was 6 seconds).
Call Observer (PvP Talent) demon health increased by 100%, range increased to 30 yards (was 20 yards), and cooldown decreased to 60 seconds (was 90 seconds).
Call Observer (PvP Talent) damage increased to 10% of a player’s max health (was 5%).
Fixed an issue where Bonds of Fel (PvP Talent) was not correctly receiving some damage modifications.
Bane of Fragility and Casting Circle (PvP Talents) have been removed.
Rapid Contagion (PvP Talent) duration decreased to 10 seconds (was 20 seconds) and now causes damage over time effects to occur 45% more often (was 33%).
Bane of Shadows (PvP Talent) has been removed.

Master Summoner (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Reduces the cast time of your Call Dreadstalkers, Summon Vilefiend, and Summon Demonic Tyrant by 20% and reduces the cooldown of Call Dreadstalkers by 5 seconds.
Call Fel Lord (PvP Talent) no longer costs Soul Shards. Fel Cleave's damage increased by 30% and is now cast 50% more frequently.
Call Fel Hunter, Pleasure through Pain, and Essence Drain (PvP Talents) have been removed.
Chaos Bolt damage increased by 60% in PvP combat (was 40%).
Shadowburn damage increased by 65% in PvP combat (was 50%).
Conflagrate damage is no longer reduced by 9% in PvP combat.
Cremation and Essence Drain (PvP Talents) have been removed.

Rebound (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Spell Reflection reflects the next 2 incoming spells cast on you and reflected spells deal 50% extra damage to the attacker. Spell Reflection's cooldown is increased by 10 seconds.
Warbringer (PvP Talent) damage reduced by 65% and range increased to 20 yard cone (was 15 yard cone).
Shockwave damage increased by 16% in PvP combat.
Shockwave duration increased to 3 seconds in PvP combat (was 2 seconds).
Storm Bolt duration decreased to 3 seconds in PvP combat (was 4 seconds).
Disarm (PvP Talent) duration decreased to 5 seconds (was 6 seconds).
Fixed an issue where Intimidating Shout did not have the correct PvP duration when talented into Menace.
Slam damage increased by 48% in PvP combat (was 40%).
Players in a duel via Duel (PvP Talent) are now highlighted for each other.

Enduring Rage (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – Movement impairing effects have a chance to grant you Enrage each second while active. While Enraged, loss of control effects have a chance to grant you Recklessness for 4 seconds when they fade.
Bloodthirst damage increased by 6% in PvP combat.
Slaughterhouse (PvP Talent) duration is now 20 seconds (was 16 seconds).
Death Wish (PvP Talent) now has a 4 second cooldown (was 5 seconds), increases damage dealt and taken by 10%, and health cost increased to 10% (was 5%). Stacks up to 5 times (was 10).
Fixed an issue that prevented Death Wish from affecting sources of damage that were not Warrior ability or auto-attack damage.
Shield Bash (PvP Talent) has been redesigned – When Shield Slam is used on targets that are casting, it reduces their damage done by 15% for 8 seconds and the cooldown is instantly reset.
Thunderstruck (PvP Talent) duration increased to 4 seconds, now obeys Diminishing Returns and breaks on damage.
Bodyguard (PvP Talent) now has a 20 yard range requirement (was 15 yards).
Sword and Board (PvP Talent) has been removed.
The "Embers of Neltharion" campaign continues! New Campaign chapters and local stories are available.

The first part of the "Embers of Neltharion" campaign is already available in game! Players can complete the prologue story, "A Creche Divided," at the Forbidden Reach in 10.0.7. This chapter begins with “The Best We Have” at the Forbidden Reach, and ends with “A Creche Divided.”

Once you finish the quest "Six Hundred Feet Under" on any character, concluding the "Breaking Ground" chapter of the Embers of Neltharion campaign, it opens up repeatable content in Zaralek Cavern for other characters on your World of Warcraft account.
A public objective is a 5-10 minute, publicly credited bonus objective. Players will all make progress towards it's completion together for rewards.
Public objectives appear as stars on the Zaralek Cavern map. Stars appear 30 seconds before public objectives become active.

Assist researchers Rannan Korren, Greta Herzig, and Thaelin Darkanvil as they investigate a Titan mining lockdown with their new niffen guides in the Zaralek Cavern. The public event will be available after weekly maintenance the week of May 9 and will be up every hour at the half-hour.

After arriving in Loamm and meeting the Niffen in the early Campaign, Myrrit invites the player to go on adventures with him. Buddy up with Myrrit to explore secret caves hidden around Zaralek Cavern up to three times a week.
These Sniffenseek digs are short puzzles that can involve stealth, sniffin', diggin', or using logic. They are approximately 5 minutes in length.
Most Zaralek Cavern World Quests and Public Objectives will become available after being introduced to Loamm during Campaign Chapter 1.
The following content will become available after the weekly maintenance starting on May 9.
Heritage armor quests for non-Allied Races no longer requires Exalted reputation with their home factions.
Updated special resource art and animations for the following classes: Arcane Mage, Death Knight, Feral Druid, Paladin, Rogue, Warlock, and Windwalker Monk.
Group Loot roll results frame (/loot) has been redesigned with a new look.
Group Loot now has a Transmogrification option that replaces Greed if the player has not collected the appearance. Transmog rolls take priority over Greed rolls.
Talent Loadouts can now be linked to chat through the Share menu.
Updated Experience and Reputation gain animations and effects.
A consistency pass has been done on scroll bars in art and functionality.
A ping animation has been added to the map when opened from the quest tracker, making it easier to spot the quest location.
Clicking on a quest icon on the map will now open the quest details in the Quest Log.
Mousing over a quest icon on the map will highlight the corresponding entry in the Quest Log, and vice versa.
Mousing over a quest icon in the Quest Log or map will temporarily show any blobs for that quest.
Legendary quest bang has an updated display art to improve readability and colorblindness considerations.
AddOn list will now display an icon or default to a question mark if the AddOn did not specify one.
In-game mail font has been changed to improve legibility.
Fixed an issue where a Hunter's nameplate could disappear after using Feign Death.
Fixed an issue where the Personal Resource Display's health bar could detach or disappear.
Fixed an issue that prevented map pins from being placed on skull, rare star, and portal icons.
The accessibility Move Pad will now remember its position on the screen between sessions.
Fixed an issue where pressing ESC while moving an Edit Mode element could cause it to be stuck to the cursor.
Fixed an issue where guild and community members logging in would close context menus.
Fixed an issue where the guild/community roster list would jump to the top whenever a member logged in.
Color contrast has been improved in PvP scoreboards.
Scoreboard table headers now have more descriptive tooltips.
"Match Average Matchmaking Value" on the Solo Shuffle scoreboard has been changed to "Role Average Matchmaking Value" to more accurately reflect Rating calculation.
The player's end-of-match Matchmaking Value has been added to the Solo Shuffle scoreboard.
Added a slash command for accessing Edit Mode: /editmode.
Cast Bar now has an option to show the cast time.
Minimap size can now be adjusted.
The Looking for Group Eye has been added to the Micro Menu frame, and its size can be adjusted.
Raid Frames will now show more buffs depending on the size of the frame, up to a maximum of 7 (was capped at 3).
Frames should no longer drag other elements that weren't manually snapped to them.
The Experience and Reputation bars have been renamed to the more generic Status Bar 1 and 2, but will still be labeled Experience Bar for leveling characters.
Pet Frame can now be moved separately from Player Frame.
The Edit Mode menu has been reorganized, with several options now hidden under Advanced Options.
The visibility toggle of the Buff and Debuff frames have been combined into one checkbox, but their functionality remains the same.
Encounter Bar will stay visible if it's already shown when entering Edit Mode.
The Raid Frame menu now has a shortcut button that opens Raid Frame settings in Interface Options.
You can now snap frames to the corners of other frames.
Objective Tracker now has an option to enable a dark background.
Added an option to disable chat.
Added a keybind option to stop ongoing Text-to-Speech.
The Interface > Raid Frames section now shows a preview of your raid frames display.
A hover state has been added to all options so you can more easily tell which line you're looking at.
The Graphics Quality section has been reorganized into tabs.
The Auto Self Cast and Self Cast Key settings have been combined into a single dropdown.
Each Action Bar now has its own keybind section that appears if that Action Bar is enabled (they were previously grouped together under one section).
Mousing over a keybind row will now highlight the corresponding action bar button, and vice versa.
Fixed an issue with Guild chat sometimes failing to load.
Fixed an issue where sound effect settings were not saving properly.
Fixed an issue with incorrect Adventure enemy positions.
Fixed an issue with missions not displaying cost reductions properly.
